intro: Spiesia aequipetala, commonly known as the smoothleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its latex-producing sap and often milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and usually have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Spiesia aequipetala produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters, which are often surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia.
